lead_paragraph: This documentary from Ruby Yang, about students who are not the expected high achievers, captures the feeling of spreading one’s wings onstage for the first time.Although “My Voice, My Life” lacks the raw emotion of “The Blood of Yingzhou District,” Ms. Yang’s Oscar-winning film on Chinese AIDS orphans, this movie does depict young lives changed, and perhaps saved. -- Helen T. Verongos
